You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Show Custom Document Types on the Product Detail Page

If you prefer custom product documentation types instead of the default values—such as Datasheets or Safety Documents—you can show those types on your storefront. Modify field definitions and dependencies for the CC Page Section and CC Product Media objects, and create records with your custom values.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To edit custom object fields:	Customize Application

For example, let's say that you want to show document types such as Maintenance Instructions and Compliance Certifications. You don't want to use any of the default document types, such as Datasheets and Safety Documents.

Customize the available values for the Media Type picklist on the CC Product Media object.
Find the fields and relationships for the CC Product Media custom object.
In Lightning Experience, click the Object Manager tab in Setup. Select CC Product Media, and then scroll to the Fields & Relationships section.
In Salesforce Classic, enter Object in the Quick Find box in Setup, and then select Objects. Select CC Product Media and scroll to Custom Fields & Relationships.
Click Media Type.
Scroll to the Values section, and click New.
Enter the document types that you want to use instead, with each value on a separate line.
For example, enter:
Maintenance Instructions
Compliance Certifications
Save your changes.
Add matching values to the Section Filter picklist on the CC Page Section object.
Find the fields and relationships for the CC Page Section custom object.
In Lightning Experience, click the Object Manager tab in Setup. Select CC Page Section, and then scroll to the Fields & Relationships section.
In Salesforce Classic, enter Object in the Quick Find box in Setup, and then select Objects. Select CC Page Section and scroll to Custom Fields & Relationships.
Click Section Filter.
Scroll to the Values section, and click New.
Enter the same document types that you added for the Media Type picklist, with each value on a separate line.
For example, enter:
Maintenance Instructions
Compliance Certifications
Save your changes.
Add a field dependency so that the Section Filter values you added are only available when an admin selects Documents for Section Name.
In the fields and relationships for the CC Page Section object, click Section Name.
Scroll to the Field Dependencies list, and click Edit on the existing dependency for the Section Filter field.
In the Documents column, select the picklist values you added for Section Filter, such as Maintenance Instructions and Compliance Certifications (1), and click Include Values (2).
Save your changes.
Create product media records for your documents. For each record's Media Type, select the custom document type you added, such as Maintenance Instructions or Compliance Certifications.
Create a page section that shows your document types. For each page section, select Documents for Section Name and then select your custom document types, such as Maintenance Instructions and Compliance Certifications, for Section Filter.

When you refresh your storefront, the custom document types appear in the page section.
